name: The Clifton Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Clifton for a couple of nights in early February 2008. Yes, the room was a bit small but, then again, so was the price we paid for it. It was clean and well furnished (could have done with a chair rather than a stool but there wasn’t enough room!) as was the en-suite. There was enough light to read by which is not usually the case in hotels.
reviews.title: Really made by the staff

reviews.text: The major plus about the hotel however was the staff: I have seldom found such helpful and pleasant people in the hotel trade. I should particularly mention the guy on Reception for most of our stay (I really should have found out his name to give him a mention…but he’ll know who he is!) for whom nothing seemed to be too much trouble and his pleasant manner makes all the difference to a stay in a hotel. Oh, and the orchids are unbelievable!
reviews.title: Would recommend!

reviews.text: We didn’t find any trouble with noise as mentioned by other reviewers but would agree with them as to how good and convenient the location of the hotel is: Bristol City Centre one way; Clifton the other. Good pubs; good food wherever you go...except at the Sausage place where we were turned away!
reviews.title: Room for a Stick Insect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The major problem with the hotel and, indeed the whole area, is the parking. There isn’t any! Luckily, we found a space on the opposite corner to the hotel when we arrived and left the car there for our entire stay.
reviews.title: Great Service, Great Location.

reviews.text: Really enjoyed it and would definitely go back.
reviews.title: Great location, need of refurbishment

reviews.text: I booked here for a last minute trip to Bristol and only afterwards read the TripAdvsior reviews. Had I read them first I would certainly not have booked. But in the event my experience was fine. I'm not sure how to explain why so many people have hated what I found to be a perfectly OK place.
reviews.title: Decent hotel in good location

description: The Clifton Hotel is situated in an ideal location for visiting Bristol within walking distance of both Clifton Village and the City Centre. A small and independent hotel part of the Clifton Hotels Group we provide clean and comfortable accommodation at competitive prices. We welcome guests with a smile priding ourselves in providing levels of customer service that were mentioned in our recent AA report as being of five star standards. We hope that guests enjoy the relaxed café reception area and our busy and vibrant restaurant Racks.
